page.title: 03Education and Schools
page.content: Skirlaugh School is a primary school. The present building is seventeen years old and has 197 pupils.There are seven classes, three are infant classes, the other four junior. Children start Skirlaugh School at the age of five and go up every September until the age of eleven. They then go to a senior school.Most of the children go to South Holderness Skirlaugh School starts at 9.00am and finishes at 3.30.There are breaks of fifteen minutes in the middle of the morning and afternoon sessions and a lunch break at noon. Many of the children stay at school for their lunch. They either bring a packed meal or pay sixty pence for a meal prepared in the school kitchen. The school has a head teacher,a secretary, seven class teachers, one aide and ten lunch and cleaning staff.
